ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Lok Swasthya SEWA Trust Works on the following activities Health Primary Health Care Services were provided for informal women workers including but not limited to vegetable vendors, construction workers and women working in small factories. These services focus on preventive health services like educationand immunization, promotion of low cost ayurvedic medicines, and curative care through primary health care and referral services. Tuberculosis-Urban Slum Scheme is working for the awareness of TB in the slums of Ahmedabad city with the support of the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation. Through this programme, awareness and referral services are provided to twenty thousand people of Asarva ward in Ahmedabad city. Since the past few years the number of TB cases particularly Multi Drug Resistant and Extreme Drug Resistant has been on the increase and the team has been involved in spreading awareness regarding the same. Occupational Health of Informal workers to create awareness about the health issues related to specific occupations, how it can be prevented and what measures need to be taken when health issues affect their work patterns and responsibilities. Empowering young women and girls to address gender-based discrimination and violence aimed to address the root causes of gender discrimination, early marriage and gender-violence. Orientation of Community Leaders of local level Committees like VHSNC, MAS, Rogi Kalyan Samiti, School Management Committee to encourage greater participation of women and enable to have a community-based monitoring mechanism to ensure better functioning of the committees. Training of Traditional Birth Attendants to improve their skill set, promote good delivery practices and connect them with existing government schemes and services for maternal and child health in different States of India. Training of Adolescent Boys and Girls to help them form their own mandals or collectives as safe spaces for support and solidarity, and for promoting their empowerment and leadership, thus enabling them to act locally on health and development related issues. SEWA Shakti Kendras or Empowerment Centres have been set up to provide information to the community members on their entitlements, where and how to access these in a timely and transparent manner. Sankalit programme or integrated approach with an aim to promote self-managed womens organizations for providing sustainable need-based services to its members for enhanced incomes and social security. Child Care and Nutrition We are running child care centres in Ahmedabad city to help informal workers increase their income while their children are taken care of at the centre. These centres also ensure good health of the children by providing nutritious food and regular growth monitoring. Additionally, a learning programme for children on safety and health protection leading to their personal development and education from kindergarten through school to vocational training has been introduced in the centres. Policy Workshop Conducted Workshop on Occupational Health and Safety of Construction Workers A workshop on Occupational Health and Safety of Construction Workers was organized by LSST. The workshop was organized with an aim to create a discourse on occupational health and safety, especially among the workers who remain unaware of the threats and risks they are exposed to at hazardous working sites. International Campaign for Right to Child Care for Informal Women Workers To understand the different child care options used by women workers in different sectors of the economy, and the challenges that they faced in balancing their work with child care responsibilities.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Achievements of the organisation: 1. Late Founder Member received the highest national award of Science and Technology Communication from Ministry of Science & Technology 2. 100 Hours of Astronomy award for Most Innovative outreach project in world by UNESCO 3. Invited Voluntary advisers for EU FP7 project SiS Catalyst 4. Made presentations on Science Communication methods and approach at several national and international forums. 5. Several papers published on Science Communication and Entrepreneurship Development Activities carried out: 1. Activity kits developed on several different scientific subjects for Department of Science & Technology, Vigyan Prasar, GUJCOST, and several other national level government departments. Special outreach material for National Radio programmes on several science subjects like Biodiversity, Mathematics, Eclipse, Human Evolution, Sanitation, Drudgery reduction, Reproductive and Child Health, and several other subjects. 2.Several Science Exhibitions developed for Department of Science & Technology and Vibrant Gujarat 3. Developed several national level campaigns on solar eclipse viewing along with Solar viewer production and Solar eclipse kits and similar subjects 4. Developed an innovative concept and kits on Miracle and Demystifying superstition. Initiators in establishing the concept of using folk toys and folk media for science communication. 5. Actively running District Science Centres supported by GUJCOST and Jilla Panchayat, Narmada District, Govt. of Gujarat. Carried out BURD projects for Energy conservation, supported by GEDA, Govt. of Gujarat. 6. Carried out Vigyan Ganga mobile science school project for the tribal district of Narmada, Gujarat. Achieved 40% improvement in curriculum based science. 7. Developed science corners in 500 Anganwadis of Kutch, Chota Udepur Districts of Gujarat. 8. Developed one of the very important 16 episode video series on Entrepreneurship for NSTEDB, Govt. of India 9. Carried out several Skill development Programmes and Entrepreneurship Development Training Programmes for DST, HRD, Government of India and Gujarat State Government. 10. Carried out Science & Technology Entrepreneurship Project in several districts of Gujarat State 11. Tribal Development programmes on biodiversity and herbal medicine 12. Innovation based Science, Technology and Design based entrepreneurship development project in Kutch and Saurashtra region of Gujarat 13. Initiators of developing Co-creation platform for village entrepreneurs and designers for better market 14. Initiators in establishing concept of Village a brand and promoting e-commerce business models Along with all the other projects, Manthan Educational Programme Society, India has designed and developed Low-cost educational communication material and publications.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Due to the ongoing of the Pandemic, no new funds were sanctioned for the year 2020-2021. Manthan Educational Programme Society, India has been working on the projects sanctioned in 2019-2020.

The project had bee supported by NCSTC under the project of Bridging the Gap for the purpose of spreading education and developing Hands on Kits for science carriculum of 5th to 8th standard. The material is planned to be outreached in Gujarat Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh as a pilot project. In this year the project was only sanctioned in February and was initiated in 2018 - 2019.

The project Learning Science While Playing has been Conducted for the NCSTC Division of DST, Government of India to develop resource material for promoting Toys for science and innovation communication.
ISTED project had been running in Kutch and Saurashtra region for the sustainability of the craft sector by involving Science, Technology and Innovation.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: MATRU SEVA is working towards facilitating community level development action groups, especially women, children and other underprivileged. Mobilization of women through formation of villages groups for economic regeneration Programme has yielded positive results. The key areas identified for interventions are local resource management, health, hygiene and environmental, education, gender, women empowerment, capacity building training programme for all stake holders, Animal Treatment camp, Yog Talim Sibir, De-addiction camp, sustainable livelihood programmes and other issues concerning the deprived class of the society. Our effort resulted in long lasting association with Government and Quasi Government agencies and also the communities and groups with whom we have worked all these years. Having its office in Kheda the organization is spreading activities in all Talukas of Kheda, Ahmadabad, Gandhinagar, Anand and Mahesana District and Diu - U.T. of Daman & Diu. The organization envisages expanding its activities to many more areas of Gujarat and Diu - U.T. of Daman & Diu.
